title: Transcript: St. Louis Fed Chief James Bullard Interviewed by WSJ
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said the U.S. central bank should start raising interest rates “sooner rather than later,” and that he sees a March rate rise as likely amid high inflation. He also said a strong job market could push the unemployment rate to under 3% this year, during an interview with The Wall Street Journal’s Michael S. Derby on Wednesday. Here is a transcript, lightly edited for clarity.
MICHAEL S. DERBY:  What’s your take on the CPI [consumer-price index] report from this morning?  Does it change anything for you, or is it just part of the – part of the ongoing story about where inflation is right now?
